intro: Zanthoxylum amamiense, commonly known as the Amami prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. Zanthoxylum amamiense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its distinctive appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
